story:
Once upon a time, in a lush and verdant valley nestled in the Ethiopian Highlands, there was a small village called Bekoji. Surrounded by fields of brightly colored flowers and herds of graceful animals, the village was home to a kind and gentle community of people who lived in harmony with nature.

In Bekoji, there lived a young boy named Tadesse who was known for his boundless curiosity and adventurous spirit. Tadesse was always exploring the village and the surrounding countryside, discovering new wonders and making friends with all the creatures he encountered along the way. His favorite place to play was the lush, green forest that bordered the village, where he would spend hours chasing butterflies, climbing trees, and listening to the melodic songs of the birds.

One day, while exploring the forest, Tadesse stumbled upon a hidden clearing, a place where the sun seemed to shine just a little bit brighter and the grass was just a little bit softer. In the center of the clearing stood a magnificent tree, taller and more majestic than any he had ever seen before. Its bark was a deep, rich brown, and its leaves shimmered with shades of gold and crimson.

As Tadesse approached the tree, he noticed a small, delicate bird perched upon one of its branches. The bird was unlike any he had ever seen, with feathers that sparkled like diamonds and a melody that seemed to fill the air with magic. Tadesse was so enchanted by the bird that he didn't notice the wise, old man who had appeared beside him.

"Who are you, and why have you come here?" the old man asked, his eyes twinkling with curiosity.

"I am Tadesse, and I was just exploring the forest when I found this beautiful tree and the magical bird that sits upon it," Tadesse replied.

The old man smiled and pointed to the bird. "That is no ordinary bird, Tadesse. That is the Kelella, the rarest and most magical creature in all of Ethiopia. It is said that the Kelella possesses the power to grant a single wish to anyone who can find it and win its heart."

Tadesse's eyes widened with excitement. "How can I win its heart?" he asked.

The old man looked thoughtful for a moment before speaking. "The Kelella is very particular about its friends. To win its heart, you must prove yourself worthy of its friendship by completing three tasks. First, you must discover the rarest flower in the forest, one that has never been seen by human eyes. Second, you must build a home for the Kelella, a place where it can live in safety and comfort. And third, you must sing the Kelella's favorite song, the song that has been passed down from generation to generation in its family."

Tadesse was determined to win the friendship of the Kelella, and he set off at once to complete the tasks the old man had set for him. He searched the forest for days, climbing steep hills and wading through babbling brooks, until at last, he found the rarest flower, a bloom so delicate and beautiful that it seemed to light up the very air around it.

Next, Tadesse built a magnificent home for the Kelella, fashioning a intricate nest from the softest and most colorful feathers he could find. He worked day and night, and when it was finally complete, he knew that it was the most magnificent home that the Kelella had ever seen.

Finally, Tadesse learned the song of the Kelella, a melody so moving and enchanting that it seemed to touch the very soul of anyone who heard it. He sang the song to the Kelella, and as he did, the bird's eyes filled with tears of joy.

"Tadesse, you have proven yourself worthy of my friendship," the Kelella said, its voice filled with emotion. "I will grant you a single wish, one that will bring happiness and prosperity to you and your family for generations to come."

Tadesse thought for a long moment before making his wish. "I wish for my village and my family to be blessed with the same kind of magic that I have found here today. I wish for us to live in harmony with nature and with each other, and for our love and kindness to be felt by all who enter our village."

The Kelella nodded, and as Tadesse made his wish, the sky above them filled with a brilliant swirl of colors, the sun and moon seeming to dance together in perfect balance. When the colors finally faded
